channel.title: Taking a Break

item.title: Taking a Break
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:9, topic:451260”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=554150.msg4058842#msg4058842 date=1343252566]

What? This is bad practice.

Using this ‘method’ is a lot more clearer to the programer, and easier to understand.

use ++i for optimization wankery like i like to do!

care to elaborate how that’s more efficient?
[/quote]
it’s very minor, and javac most likely resolves it itself, but: i++ requires storing an intermediate value, incrementing it, and returning it whereas ++i doesn’t. it makes me sleep well at night :).[/quote]Didn’t know this thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Taking a Break
item.dc:creator: @NieX NieX
item.description:
@NieX wrote:

[quote=“Skyro, post:1, topic:451260”][font=verdana][size=13px]Hey MoparScape,[/size][/font]

[font=verdana][size=13px]I’m adding a feature to my script but it is imprinting the letter ‘i’ and not the Int. How do I make it print the int?Here is my code.[/size][/font]

[code=java]

public void takeBreak() {
for (int i = 10; i >= 0; i = i - 1) {
Time.sleep(SLEEP_TIME);
Status = “i”;
}
}
[/code][/quote]

Why do you have quotation marks for a start? secondly if you remove the quotation marks all it’s going to do is declare the Int i equal to whatever Status is? Also it’s good to get into the habit of using shortened functions such as --i instead of i = i - 1;

Read full topic

item.title: Taking a Break
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Skyro, post:1, topic:451260”] Status = "i"; [/quote]
Why is Status capitalized :|… naming conventions

Read full topic

item.title: Taking a Break
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Time.sleep(SLEEP_TIME); Status = "i";
It will only do this^ once because it is going to loop until i >= 0, and you set i to ten…
It would be better to switch it around.

Read full topic

item.title: Taking a Break
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

I mix ‘conventions’ of C and Java a lot; albeit they’re similar (inb4 there’s no conventions for C blabla; this is why I quoted the word). I find camel casing and spelling out a full name to be irritating at times. Capitalizing field/method names, though, is C# faggotry.

Read full topic

item.title: Taking a Break
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

[quote=“Whackatre, post:6, topic:451260”]Why is Status uppercase?[/quote]If he followed conventions, we could all assume Status is the name of a class.

Also check if you have actually declare status before(and remove the capital) as a string or an integer maybe?

Read full topic

item.title: Taking a Break
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:8, topic:451260”][quote author=t4 link=topic=554150.msg4058826#msg4058826 date=1343251647]

What? This is bad practice.

Using this ‘method’ is a lot more clearer to the programer, and easier to understand.

use ++i for optimization wankery like i like to do!
[/quote]
care to elaborate how that’s more efficient?[/quote]
it’s very minor, and javac most likely resolves it itself, but: i++ requires storing an intermediate value, incrementing it, and returning it whereas ++i doesn’t. it makes me sleep well at night :).

item.title: Taking a Break
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

What? This is bad practice.

[code]for (int i = 0; i <= 10; i++)[/code]
Using this 'method' is a lot more clearer to the programer, and easier to understand.

What? This is bad practice.

Using this ‘method’ is a lot more clearer to the programer, and easier to understand.

item.title: Taking a Break
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

vortex:

You remove the quotation marks?? wtf

I’ve already tried, and don’t worry I figured it out.

I had to modify it to look like this;

Status = "Resuming in " + i + ".";
